mlr3fselect v0.1.0-9000

FSelectRandom Class

Source: R/FSelectRandom.R
FSelectRandom.Rd

Subclass for random feature selection. Feature sets are randomly drawn.

Dictionary

This FSelect can be instantiated via the dictionary mlr_fselectors or with the associated sugar function fs():

mlr_fselectors$get("random")
fs("random")

Parameters

max_features

integer(1)
Maximum number of features. By default, number of features in mlr3::Task.

batch_size

integer(1)
Maximum number of feature sets to try in a batch.

prob

double(1)
Probability of choosing a feature.

In order to support general termination criteria and parallelization, feature sets are evaluated in a batch-fashion of size batch_size. Larger batches mean more is parallelized, smaller batches imply a more fine-grained checking of termination criteria.

Super classes

bbotk::Optimizer -> mlr3fselect::FSelect -> FSelectRandom

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

FSelectRandom$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

library(mlr3)

terminator = term("evals", n_evals = 10)
instance = FSelectInstance$new(
  task = tsk("iris"),
  learner = lrn("classif.rpart"),
  resampling = rsmp("holdout"),
  measures = msr("classif.ce"),
  terminator = terminator
)

fs = fs("random")
fs$optimize(instance)
instance$result
#> $feat
#> [1] "Petal.Width"
#> 
#> $perf
#> classif.ce 
#>       0.02 
#> 
instance$archive$data
